docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 16 (AP) -- The Reconstruction Finance Corporation raised to 5 per cent today its interest rate on disaster loans granted to restore profit-making business facilities and inventories. Interest charges on the loans -- available to v...
docs.abstract: Interest rate on disaster loans to businesses raised from 3 to 5% by RFC
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 16 (AP) -- The Reconstruction Finance Corporation raised to 5 per cent today its interest rate on disaster loans granted to restore profit-making business facilities and inventories. Interest charges on the loans -- available to victims of floods, storms, fires and earthquakes -- formerly were a uniform 3 per cent.

headline.main: DISASTER LOAN RATE FOR BUSINESS RAISED

docs.snippet: Cincinnati officially appealed to President Roosevelt today for government aid in removing the menace of floods such as already have caused damage of millions of dollars in the Ohio River Valley....

headline.main: CINCINNATI APPEALS FOR FLOOD CONTROL; Message to Roosevelt Urges an Investigation Be Made--Two Plans Now Under Study

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES, Sept. 3. -- Unusual precautions were taken to give to the drought conference the appearance of being non-political and to safeguard the President and other officials.

headline.main: DES MOINES BARS SIGNS OF POLITICS; Gov. Herring Even Removes Bust of President From the Conference Room. PARLEY CLOSELY GUARDED Employes Are Barred From the State Capitol and Offices Are Closed for the Day.

docs.snippet: EN ROUTE WITH PRESIDENT ROOSEVELT THROUGH THE DROUGHT AREA. -- In a career distinguished by the unusual, President Roosevelt has found still another means of asserting his individual manner of doing things as day after day he rides by train and au...
docs.lead_paragraph: EN ROUTE WITH PRESIDENT ROOSEVELT THROUGH THE DROUGHT AREA. -- In a career distinguished by the unusual, President Roosevelt has found still another means of asserting his individual manner of doing things as day after day he rides by train and automobile across the prairie's dusty face to study at first hand the ravages of the drought and the means being taken to alleviate these conditions.

headline.main: ROOSEVELT DRAMATIZES NATION'S SOIL PROBLEM; Tour of the Western Drought Belt Has Fixed Public Attention on Program For Relief and Made New Friends

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ALBANY, July 13. -- Forty-one persons were killed and damage amounting to millions of dollars was caused by floods in the southern tier of New York counties this week....

headline.main: FULL STATE POWER MOBILIZED IN FLOOD; With Lehman at the Helm, All Branches Were Busy Few Hours After Havoc Began.
